title: Georgia O’Keeffe Sky above Clouds IV Tote
description:
Foldable Tote developed from Georgia O’Keeffe’s Sky above Clouds IV, 1965, from The Art Institute of Chicago’s collection. 

Painted in the summer of 1965, when Georgia O’Keeffe was 77 years old, this monumental work culminates a series inspired by the artist’s experiences as an airplane passenger during the 1950s. Working in Abiquiu, New Mexico, O’Keeffe began around 1963 to capture the endless expanses of clouds she had observed from airplane windows during trips all over the world. 

  • Dimensions: 16 in. x 26 in.  Folded:  4.5 x 5 in 
  • Materials: 100% Polyester.
  • Hand wash, hang dry.
  • Folded Tote has small clip to link to a key chain.
